channel.title: What differentiates us from other communities?
channel.description:
I recently signed up on Rune-Server, and started browsing through their site and some other less popular gaming communities. Seeing that R-S gets a surplus of 400 members online daily, I started to think about what separates Mopar from other places. Some factors that I've come up with:
[ul][li]Mopar = SMF; R-S = vBulletin[/li] [li]Mopar != transactions; R-S = transactions[/li] [li]The toplist is integrated as a page with Rune-Server, Mopar offers it as an external page, open-source, and a redirect board.[/li] [li]Rune-Server offers more membergroups to their members, with some of them being: [list] [li]Varied donator ranks[/li] [li]The veteran rank[/li] [li]Various guru-based membergroups[/li] [li][i]Take note that the shown groups all have icons to go along with these ranks, while MoparScape does not offer icons for the first two.[/i][/li] [/list][/li] [li]MoparScape offers:[/li][list] [li]Various post-based usergroups[/li] [li]Community member[/li] [li]MoparScape veteran[/li] [li]Server helper[/li] [li]Various guru-based membergroups[/li] [/list] [li]Each community tends to attract people with differing goals and willingness to learn and achieve.[/li] [li]Falling under the same category as stated above, the maturity level of the members involved in each community tends to differ.[/li][/ul]
What [i]does[/i] separate one community from the next? Why are you here and not there? Discuss.

item.title: What differentiates us from other communities?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:34, topic:505532”][quote author=Elrick link=topic=623761.msg4254741#msg4254741 date=1362536463]

And this would play into one of the factors of them having a supposedly ‘less mature’ community?

Lmao, yes it does. The community is self regulating here. We don’t rely on moderators who are potential jerks to take care of the community aka be power hungry apparently.
[/quote]
Whether or not it is visible, moderators of both communities carry a substancial amount of authority. How this power is executed is a different manner, and I don’t find it necessary to point any fingers (generalized thought; not aimed towards you).[/quote]
You best be not questioning us.

Read full topic

[quote=“iCreatedHorror, post:31, topic:505532”][quote author=mr arrows95 link=topic=623761.msg4254693#msg4254693 date=1362530925]
This has been discussed so much.
We’re never going to change, we’re an information board, we’re not completely obsessed with making money.
[/quote]I’m nearly positive that this wasn’t a “we need to change” style thread but instead a “what makes each community different”.[/quote]
Exactly.[quote=“sppt, post:29, topic:505532”]This forum isn’t filled with images and ads everywhere.

/thread[/quote]
Good point.

item.title: What differentiates us from other communities?
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:26, topic:505532”][quote author=Elrick link=topic=623761.msg4254561#msg4254561 date=1362518977]
There is a law of the people here. Obviously we have guidelines, but we generally respect each other because we will the community to be that way. And if some steps out of line, the community puts them in their place.
[/quote]
So do other communities not share this with us? I do see active moderation on places such as Rune-Server, yet I haven’t been there long enough to see the quality of their jobs.[/quote]
Most of their moderators are incredibly bad. There’s only a few I actually like, Xenon, Rash, Method when he was still there. The rest of them are honestly more or less idiots. Especially from what I can see of scu11. Seems to try the whole Davidi2 tough love thing and epicly fails and appears to be a giant cock.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Ruby; that was what I was describing when I’d said that Mopar is the place to be once you know what you’re doing. Rune-Server would act as the stairs to get to here, in terms of being able to be here without having to be spoonfed.
Arcik; That was one of my points, being that R-S offers things that Mopar does not, and vise-versa.

item.title: What differentiates us from other communities?
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:1, topic:505532”]I recently signed up on Rune-Server, and started browsing through their site and some other less popular gaming communities.
Seeing that R-S gets a surplus of 400 members online daily, I started to think about what separates Mopar from other places.
Some factors that I’ve come up with:

[ul][li]Mopar = SMF; R-S = vBulletin[/li]
[li]Mopar != transactions; R-S = transactions[/li]
[li]The toplist is integrated as a page with Rune-Server, Mopar offers it as an external page, open-source, and a redirect board.[/li]
[li]Rune-Server offers more membergroups to their members, with some of them being:
[list]
[li]Varied donator ranks[/li]
[li]The veteran rank[/li]
[li]Various guru-based membergroups[/li]
[li]Take note that the shown groups all have icons to go along with these ranks, while MoparScape does not offer icons for the first two.[/li]
[/list][/li]
[li]MoparScape offers:[/li][list]
[li]Various post-based usergroups[/li]
[li]Community member[/li]
[li]MoparScape veteran[/li]
[li]Server helper[/li]
[li]Various guru-based membergroups[/li]
[/list]
[li]Each community tends to attract people with differing goals and willingness to learn and achieve.[/li]
[li]Falling under the same category as stated above, the maturity level of the members involved in each community tends to differ.[/li][/ul]

What does separate one community from the next? Why are you here and not there?
Discuss.[/quote]
SMF is actually a better forums software than vBulletin, a lot better. If we were to allow transactions and payments it would 1) completely fuck up the fundamentals and base thoughts on which the community was made and 2) there would be a lot more scamming. 3) If you knew anything about this you’d realise our toplist is actually integrated with our forums. It may not follow the same look, but the SSI is in place almost everywhere. If you start adding all these different rank it makes the community look like it’s run by an eleven year old and gives reason for more elitism (I paid more therefore I am better) or even I paid 50$ for my rank you can’t ban me arguments. Their community is also full of spoonfeeding and I’m just not cut out for that, I’ll happily help people but I’m not going to talk them through every single step every single time. In my opinion MoparScape is the original and best and I’ll be here for as long as there’s a set of forums for us to use.

Read full topic
item.source: What differentiates us from other communities?

END OF STORY.

item.source: What differentiates us from other communities?

item.title: What differentiates us from other communities?
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“Fails, post:16, topic:505532”]@Flame: not necessarily. although mscp may be a chill, laid-back community, that doesn’t mean all ‘retire-ees’ flock here. (Which we don’t want anyway :P). They generally stay with their forum of choice.

There’s nothing going for mscp anymore, though (development wise). Everyone who actually had potential, that wasn’t apart of mitb, is long gone, minus a select few. We are more of a general forum now.[/quote]

Is that such a bad thing though? We always will have an influx of great programmers coming here and doing their own thing. I think that’s a valuable trait for us to have. While someone can go to either community, I believe our community mentors and receives programmers better than google does and even if they do leave (hateful to the community or not), we got to experience someone grow into something great.

EDIT: and while some of us might not know much about programming as a whole, we’ve know enough basics to get someone who can become great at programming to get them started with ease.

Read full topic
item.source: What differentiates us from other communities?

item.title: What differentiates us from other communities?
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

My first impression of R-S was that the site is ugly. As for R-L, well, just never bothered to navigate over there except for the Item, NPC, and objects databases. I like SMF and this was the first site I joined and I’ve just kind of stayed around lurking for the most part. I find it nice that people aren’t blowing up signatures with overly sized images or stupid flashing names, etc.

Plus, I’ve made friends here, but I talk to them mostly through IRC now.

Read full topic
item.source: What differentiates us from other communities?

@Flame: not necessarily. although mscp may be a chill, laid-back community, that doesn’t mean all ‘retire-ees’ flock here. (Which we don’t want anyway :P). They generally stay with their forum of choice.

There’s nothing going for mscp anymore, though (development wise). Everyone who actually had potential, that wasn’t apart of mitb, is long gone, minus a select few. We are more of a general forum now.

Read full topic

item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Fails, post:9, topic:505532”]R-S has more members than us, cool. I’d much rather be here with the people I know and love opposed to being on a site with a bunch of 10yr old c0ck-blocks.

Lets face it, the only members active on mscp have been here for years. We don’t attract many new members, but I’m okay with that. If I ever feel like I need to be surrounded by donator ranks, I’ll head on over to R-S.[/quote]

I haven’t been here for years.
